name: Peas Pulao
history: Peas Pulao, also known as Matar Pulao, is a popular dish in Indian cuisine. It's a flavorful rice preparation where basmati rice is cooked with green peas and aromatic spices. It's a versatile dish often served with curries, raita, or as a standalone meal.
description: Peas Pulao is a simple yet delicious rice dish made with fragrant basmati rice, green peas, and a blend of spices like cumin, cloves, and cinnamon. It's a light and aromatic dish, perfect as a quick meal or as a complement to other Indian dishes.

instructions.title: Prepare the Rice
instructions.description: Wash the basmati rice thoroughly until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain.

instructions.title: Cook the Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil or ghee in a pan or pressure cooker. Add cumin seeds, cloves, cinnamon, cardamom, and bay leaf. SautÃ© for a minute until fragrant. Add sliced onions and ginger-garlic paste, and sautÃ© until the onions turn golden.

instructions.title: Add Rice and Peas
instructions.description: Add the drained rice and green peas to the pan. Stir gently to mix with the spices.

instructions.title: Cook the Pulao
instructions.description: Add water and salt to the rice mixture. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook until the rice is done and all the water is absorbed (about 18-20 minutes). If using a pressure cooker, cook for 2-3 whistles.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Fluff the rice gently with a fork. Serve the Peas Pulao hot, garnished with additional fried onions or fresh herbs, if desired.

tips: Soaking the basmati rice prior to cooking helps in achieving a fluffier texture.
Adjust the quantity of green peas to your liking.
variations: Add other vegetables like carrots or beans for a more nutritious dish.
For a richer flavor, cook the rice in vegetable or chicken broth instead of water.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on the stove until warm.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl with a side of raita or plain yogurt.
Garnish with fried cashews or raisins for added texture and flavor.
